title: Renault Creates Chief Growth Officer Role in Bid to Revamp Business
description: New Chief Executive Francois Provost created the post and made a series of senior appointments as he positions to get the French carmaker back into shape.
content:
Renault’s Fabrice Cambolive at an event in Rio de Janeiro. The group said Cambolive would take over as chief growth officer immediately, while keeping his role as CEO of the Renault brand.

Renault RNO 1.64%increase; green up pointing triangle created a new chief growth officer position and made a series of senior appointments as new Chief Executive Francois Provost moves to get the French carmaker back into shape.

The group said Fabrice Cambolive would take over as chief growth officer effective immediately, while keeping his role as CEO of the Renault brand. He will oversee both the Renault and Dacia brands and lead the group’s international development, with India, Latin America and South Korea being identified as priority markets.

keywords.name: a new chief growth officer position

summary: Renault has created a new role in its business, with the creation of a new chief growth officer position and a series of senior appointments. The role will be held by the company's new CEO, Philippe Petrov, who will oversee both the Renault and Dacia. The new role is part of a wider effort to revitalise the company.
shortSummary: Renault has appointed Fabrice Cambolive as its chief growth officer, aiming to revive the company's fortunes under new CEO Francois Provost.
